story:
Short Summary

We are an all volunteer theater group that provides a Haunted attraction as a fundraiser for the Charis Center for the Arts in Bowie, Maryland.   All proceeds from the operation of the Haunted attraction will go to the Charis Center for the Arts, offering art, music and drama classes  to lower-income children.

Our production offers something for the whole family.  We have a Boo area for the younger children with Face Painting and other fun activities. This allows parents to go through the Haunt with older children or by themselves.

We always offer discounts for members of the  Military, Law Enforcement, First Responders and anyone who brings non-perishable food for the local food bank.

The Haunted Maze is focused on a storyline and not on blood and gore.  Here are some photos from our 2013 production:

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds for materials to build this year’s Haunted Maze. We have some lumber, some nails, all the lighting and all the animatronics, pneumatics, and costumes needed.

What we need to purchase are more lumber, nails, screws and paint to complete the scene build outs for the maze.

PERKS:

If you can contribute, we have perks available, at a variety of levels, as our way of saying Thank You! Anyone contributing any amount will be named on our web site as a contributor. 

$1 donation level – We will add you name to a list of contributors on our website.

If you are able to donate $10 dollars of more, we promise we will NOT to send a Zombie to your home, to personally seek a donation! You will also receive the perks for the $1 donation level.

For a donation of $50 dollars, we will send you 2 tickets to go through the maze. These tickets are good for any night we are open during the 2014 season. You will also receive the perks for the $1 and $10 donation levels.

For the extreme Halloween Lovers who are able to donate $100 dollars, we will name a monster featured in this year’s Haunted Maze after you, and we will send you 2 tickets to go through the maze. Again, these tickets are good for any night we are open during the 2014 season. You will also receive the perks for the $1 and $10 donation levels.

Finally, for the Biggest Halloween Fan within 10 miles of Bowie MD, with your donation of $500 we will Name a monster featured in this year’s Haunted Maze after you and we will send you 2 tickets to go through the maze. Again these tickets are good for any night we are open during the 2014 season. You will also receive the perks for the $1 and $10 donation levels.  The best part is we will send a Horde of Zombies to your home (or the home of your choosing) to show our appreciation for your generosity!

story:
Our Story

The Ballet Folklórico Jalisciense, based in San Ysidro, CA, was established in 1984 under the direction of Mary Lopez. Over the years, it has established a strong presence in the greater San Diego area and Baja California region.

Recently, the group has had the tremendous opportunity of presenting our dances on the international stage. In 2008 and 2011, the group traveled to China to participate in its first overseas performance. In 2013, the BFJ was invited to participate in an international dance festival in Finland. These trips were quite transformative for the group members, giving us insight into what it means to present on stage our cultural heritage through dance.

This summer, we will be participating in the 41st International Folklore Festival in southern Brazil. Your contribution to our campaign will go directly to our travel fund. You will be giving us the opportunity to share a part of our Mexican heritage with people from all over the world. Furthermore, this festival will allow us to learn different traditions and dances from other international participants.

What We Need & What You Get

Obviously, $1,500 will not be enough to cover all of our plane tickets. However, this money is a significant amount that will make a difference! $1,500 will allow all of us to travel together to Brazil.

As a token of our appreciation, you will get fun perks with any donation you make to our campaign. These include: postcards, t-shirts, the option for an exclusive performance, and much more! (See details below).

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to donate. You can still help us out by attending our annual summer concert, “Día del Folklor” (June 28th. 7:00pm. Saville Theater. San Diego City College).  Proceeds will go directly to our travel fund.

You can also hire us for a private performance in the greater San Diego area. We perform at parties, weddings, quinceañeras, and much more! Find us on Facebook under “Ballet Folklorico Jalisciense” and send us a message for more details.

story:
Brussels, PARTS & the Arts!

  • My name is Tiffany Martin- I am a student and an aspiring performing artist and choreographer/director. Currently I am majoring in Dance & Theater at University of California Davis. I have been passionate about dance & theater throughout my life and it is my deep desire to continue working in the arts world- to dance, create original productions, and teach.
  • I began dancing at a very young age. Growing up in the Sierra foothills, in Placerville, California there were very few opportunities to study dance. So, I became very involved in the theater world, and eventually began creating and mounting original dance/theatre productions involving many artists in the community. I produced three original, devised shows, all of which incorporated dancers and non-dancers. These shows received ample positive feedback from the community. They were all free to the public, and the money we did raise helped support the high school theater program. This is the type of work I would like to continue to create & mount.
  • I recently transferred to UC Davis to continue studying dance. I am a third-year undergraduate, and will be graduating next spring 2015.
  • Dance is an integral part of my life; I wish to make a life and a living centered on the arts. Next summer 2015, I have the unique opportunity to continue my education abroad in Brussels, Belgium. I have been accepted into the summer program at the contemporary dance school P.A.R.T.S., established by dance pioneer Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker. The summer session includes a variety of classes in Yoga, Contemporary dance technique, Movement improvisation, and choreography taught by renowned teachers. I strongly believe that this workshop will be a great post-graduation opportunity, a way to meet teachers & make connections. Going abroad, to a place like Belgium, a hub of cutting-edge performance arts culture, would broaden my perspectives as an artist. I have no doubt that it will deepen my knowledge and help me to move forward with my own work. My experience at PARTS will ripple outward into the arts community, as it will help me continue to mount dance productions and teach dance in the local area.  More on PARTS here: http://www.parts.be/en/summer-projects
  • While in Europe, I hope to visit the surrounding countries France, the Netherlands, and Germany. There are many dance and theater events going on all summer in these areas, and I hope to involve myself in additional workshops, as well as see performances. If I can manage to raise enough funds, I will also attend classes & workshops at ImPulsTanz in Vienna, Austria. ImPulsTanz is an amazing dance festival with classes & performances galore. More on ImPulsTanz: http://www.impulstanz.com/en/
  • All this depends a great deal on your support...

Your Support

  • I am going to UC Davis on an academic/need-based scholarship. Because of the often unstable financial realities of working as an artist, I chose not to take out any student loans. So, I am a full-time student and I also work several jobs to cover the costs of living. In this way, I have no extra funds for educational trips. So, in order to make this trip to Brussels happen, I am in need of financial support.
  • $3,000 will cover the costs of tuition, a plane ticket, housing, and necessities.
  • There are awesome, artsy, handmade, & heartfelt thank-you gifts for all donations, from $10 to $500+. Please check out the perks and see what gifts you can receive for your support.

The Impact

  • This experience will help me grow as an individual, an student, an artist, and a future teacher of the arts. Your support here will go back into the world ten-fold, guaranteed. I see my work as an artist in the greater spectrum of the community and the world, and am always giving back with my work.
  • I have created Kickstarter campaigns for my last two dance/theater productions, both of which were funded & completed successfully, and all promises met. 

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Can’t contribute but want to help? Spread the word!! Share on facebook, or any other medium. Tell your friends and family. Share!

·  Would you like to help support this cause in some other way? Please feel free to contact me- I would love to hear your thoughts!

·  Thank you for your time & support!
story_txt:
Brussels, PARTS & the Arts! 

My name is Tiffany Martin- I am a student and an
     aspiring performing artist and choreographer/director. Currently I am
     majoring in Dance & Theater at University of California Davis. I have
     been passionate about dance & theater throughout my life and it is my
     deep desire to continue working in the arts world- to dance, create original
     productions, and teach. 
I began dancing at a very young age. Growing up in
     the Sierra foothills, in Placerville, California there were very few
     opportunities to study dance. So, I became very involved in the theater
     world, and eventually began creating and mounting original dance/theatre
     productions involving many artists in the community. I produced three
     original, devised shows, all of which incorporated dancers and non-dancers.
     These shows received ample positive feedback from the community. They were
     all free to the public, and the money we did raise helped support the high
     school theater program. This is the type of work I would like to continue to create & mount. 

I recently transferred to UC Davis to continue studying
     dance. I am a third-year undergraduate, and will be graduating next spring
     2015. 
Dance is an integral part of my life; I wish to make a
     life and a living centered on the arts. Next summer 2015, I have the unique opportunity to
     continue my education abroad in Brussels, Belgium. I have been accepted
     into the summer program at the contemporary dance school P.A.R.T.S.,
     established by dance pioneer Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker. The summer
     session includes a variety of classes in Yoga, Contemporary dance
     technique, Movement improvisation, and choreography taught by renowned
     teachers. I strongly believe that this workshop will be a great post-graduation opportunity, a way to meet teachers & make connections. Going abroad, to a place like Belgium, a hub of
     cutting-edge performance arts culture, would broaden my perspectives as an
     artist. I have no doubt that it will deepen my knowledge
     and help me to move forward with my own work. My experience at PARTS
     will ripple outward into the arts community, as it will help me continue
     to mount dance productions and teach dance in the local area.  More on PARTS here: http://www.parts.be/en/summer-projects

While in Europe, I hope to visit the surrounding
     countries France, the Netherlands, and Germany. There are many dance and
     theater events going on all summer in these areas, and I hope to involve
     myself in additional workshops, as well as see performances. If I can manage to raise enough funds, I will also attend classes & workshops at ImPulsTanz in Vienna, Austria. ImPulsTanz is an amazing dance festival with classes & performances galore. More on ImPulsTanz: http://www.impulstanz.com/en/

All this depends a great deal on your support...

Your Support 

I am going to UC Davis on an academic/need-based
     scholarship. Because of the often unstable financial realities of working
     as an artist, I chose not to take out any student loans. So, I am a
     full-time student and I also work several jobs to cover the costs of
     living. In this way, I have no extra funds for educational trips. So, in order
     to make this trip to Brussels happen, I am in need of financial support. 
$3,000 will cover the costs of tuition, a plane ticket,
     housing, and necessities. 
There are awesome, artsy, handmade, & heartfelt
     thank-you gifts for all donations, from $10 to $500+. Please check out the
     perks and see what gifts you can receive for your support.
The
Impact

This experience will help me grow as an individual, an
     student, an artist, and a future teacher of the arts. Your support here
     will go back into the world ten-fold, guaranteed. I see my work as an
     artist in the greater spectrum of the community and the world, and am
     always giving back with my work. 
I have created Kickstarter campaigns for my last two
     dance/theater productions, both of which were funded & completed
     successfully, and all promises met.  
Other
Ways You Can Help
· 
Can’t contribute but want to help?
Spread the word!! Share on facebook, or any other medium. Tell your friends and
family. Share! 
· 
Would you like to help support this
cause in some other way? Please feel free to contact me- I would love to hear
your thoughts!
· 
Thank you for your time &
support!

story:
Hello, I am Svetlana Ovsyannikova, the artistic director at OvsyannikovaDance. 

   OvsyannikovaDance is a new dance and physical theatre company that eloquently explores new and exciting contemporary dance choreography, performance, film and teaching opportunities in Bristol, London and Internationally. We are starting on a journey to fully establish our dance company, research and develop our new programme "The dance tale", perform in the variety of locations and site sensitive venues (including London and Bristol) and finally create a dance film of this journey. 

Please help us in achieving our goals, and bring dance to a wide variety of audiences. Every little bit counts, will be greatly appreciated and put to good use. Should you wish to find out more about this project, please visit our website www.ovsyannikovadance.com or contact us at svetlana.ovsyannikova1@gmail.com

★ What is OvsyannikovaDance company?

★ How can you help us establish ourself and start promoting dance and make our work more accessible to a larger audiencies in Bristol and UK?

★ Is it possible to make it happen on your generosity and our passion of dancers/ collaborators/ artists?

★ What will you contribute towards?

These are some of the questions I am tackling working towards establishing and pursuing those goals. There are 3 dancers, 1 choreographer, 1 musician, 1 film director and a number of creative individuals who are willing to be a part of it.

The R&D starts this weeks and we have being supported partially by Redbridge Local Council towards developing it. We are very grateful for their trust and eager to provide a great programme for the most disadvantaged areas of East London, where we will engage children and their parents in "The Dance Tale" production within the libraries on 8th July, 2014. 

However the reality of today is that we are in need to fundraise to match fund this venture, so we can cover all of artists expenses and rentals.

The work premieres on Tuesday, July 8, 2014 with 2 performances at Central library, Redbridge in the children’s area, at 10.30AM followed by a dance workshop at Woodford Green library and the second show which starts at 2.30. 

The dance tale will coincide with a series of FREE community events produced by Vision in East London and by OvsyannikovaDance in various outdoor locations during August and September in Bristol, that will include a performance, a workshop and a film screening, public discussions with scholars and activists; and teach-ins. The community events are designed to give people the opportunity to actively engage, learn and participate with the different ideals of art, dance, history, choreography, dance making, performance and healthy life style that OvsyannikovaDance and dancers believe are crucial to the UK's society nowadays. 

The generosity of people like you, make the community events and production of The dance Tale possible as well as will allow us to further establish our company growth.

Your donation, no mater what size, is needed! The entire cost for the event is £5000 and we are asking for your help in reaching our Indiegogo goal. 

I look forward to sharing with you - "The dance Tale" and OvsyannikovaDance's further journey and development.

Sincerely & passionately,

Svetlana Ovsyannikova

Journey to OvsyannikovaDance and "The Dance Tale"

Performances: Tuesday, July 8 (London) and July 19 and August 2, 9 (Brsitol),  2014.

Where: Central library, Redbridge in the children’s area, at 10.30AM followed by the dance workshop and Woodford Green library at 2.30.  July 19 Bristol - TBA, August 2, 9, 2014 Bristol - TBA.

Tickets:  FREE for all

Dancers: Ben Nash, Moe Kitafuji, Rebecca D'andrea, Svetlana Ovsyannikova.

Musician: Julian Hamlin

Collaborator: Lisa May Thomas

Film maker/ director and editor: Sadie Coles

Film director: Svetlana Ovsyannikova

story:
The Story So Far

 

In the summer of 2018, with the help of over 300 backers on Indiegogo, we produced Reborning by Zayd Dohrn in Vancouver, B.C. Our production starred Emily Bett Rickards, Paul Piaskowski and Lori Triolo, and was a hit with audiences and critics alike.

"Reality Curve Theatre’s production of Reborning is an intense ride that escalates into complex traumatic territory."

"Rickards does a phenomenal job carrying this show. Her nuanced portrayal of Kelly feels approachable and charismatic, yet sarcastic. She lets us see a wide spectrum of the character – both the light and dark."

"Rickards gives us a painfully powerful Kelly, trapped in the trauma of her infancy and moved by forces she can’t possibly control. Her physical and emotional descent into madness is impressive.​"

This year we have an incredible opportunity to bring our production of Reborning Off-Broadway to New York City for a 4.5 week run at the SoHo Playhouse from July 5 - August 3. 

 

The Play

 

Art and life become disturbingly interchangeable when a sculptor of baby dolls meets a woman desperate to recreate the past.

Kelly is a Reborning artist - she creates lifelike dolls, often based on real babies - sometimes for collectors, other times for mothers dealing with the loss of their infants. Kelly lives with her boyfriend Daizy who is a sculptor of a different variety. Things take a dramatic turn for them both when new client Emily commissions baby doll Eva.

The dark comedy that ensues takes an unsettling look at love, loss, trauma, and the power of creation.

 

The Cast

 

Emily Bett Rickards Kelly

Emily is a Canadian actress best know for her 7 seasons as Felicity Smoak on CW’s smash hit Arrow, as well as it’s spin-offs The Flash and Legends of Tomorrow. She appeared in the Oscar nominated Brooklyn, and has been nominated for Leo Awards, Teen Choice Awards and MTV awards.

 

Paul Piaskowski Daizy

Paul is an actor and producer born in Warsaw, Poland, raised in Melbourne, Australia, currently calling Vancouver home. Recent theatre credits include The Pillowman by Martin McDonagh and Bug by Tracy Letts. He can currently be seen in the SundanceTV limited series Unspeakable and Jordan Peele's The Twilight Zone.

 

Lori Triolo Emily/Director

Originally from New York, Lori began the study of acting with Sanford Meisner at the Neighbourhood Playhouse. Lori has received Best Actress Leo Award and Leading Actress Jessie Award nominations for her work on both the screen and stage (including for her role in Reality Curve Theatre's production of Bug by Tracy Letts).

 

The Company

 

Reality Curve Theatre is a registered not-for-profit theatre company based in Vancouver B.C. Through the production of modern, relevant, and entertaining theatre our mission is to foster a positive perception and a new appreciation for the medium, attracting non-theatre goers and younger audiences to the theatre.

 

Wait.. What is Reborning?

 

A reborn doll is a manufactured doll that has been sculpted by an artist to resemble a human infant with as much realism as possible. The process of creating a reborn doll is referred to as reborning and the doll artists are referred to as reborners. Reborn dolls are also known as lifelike dolls or reborn baby dolls.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

As a registered not-for-profit theatre company, funding is always a challenge. We need funds for a variety of production expenses, including music licensing, insurance, visa costs, travel costs, set construction, props, and production rights.

In exchange for your support, we've assembled cool perks to show our appreciation. Some of them are tangible items, other are experiences, including coming to see the show and meeting the cast.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't contribute, that's cool! There are other ways you can help. Like getting the word out about both this campaign and the show itself. You can share this page with your friends / family / colleagues / ex-partners / neighbours / random people - it really would mean the world to us! Thank you!

story:
Our Story

For the past 3 years, I've written and directed original musicals at Saint Rose. I can honestly say that it has been the best experience of my life. This is my last year doing this, and I could really use some help! Roger That: The Sleuthsical is a murder mystery musical that takes place at a circus. I have a lot of faith in this show, and there's so much that I would love to do with it. However, I don't get paid to do this, and I don't get a budget, so any money that goes into the show comes out of my pocket. Any amount that you could contribute would be extremely helpful and appreciated. The show will be March 30 & 31 in St. Joe's Auditorium


The Impact

While writing and directing a show is difficult on top of being a full-time student, I've come across a lot of obstacles that could be fixed. The school can only provide 3 handheld microphones for us to use that aren't even designed for us to sing with. Having to hold the microphone, and pass it off to other actors on stage during a scene is distracting and frustrating. Having to block the scenes around this is annoying, and really limits all the things that I could do. Additionally, the backstage area of the auditorium is very limited. There is essentially no where for the actors to go when they're not in a scene, so having to fit props and scenery back there is also really difficult. I would love to be able to build a set that not only sets up the scene that is happening, but also extends the back stage area so that we can easily move around to ensure that nobody gets hurt moving around backstage in the dark. 


What We Need & What You Get

Microphones and sound equipment = $500

Materials to build a set = $300

Cost to record & produce soundtrack = $75

Other costs & needs = $75


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If everybody donates a little, it can add up to make all of this possible!

story:
Who We Are

 

The New Deal Theatre – the brand new theatre arm of Aquila Morong Studio for Actors.

 

Aquila Morong Studio for Actors was founded by Deborah Aquila and Donna Morong who began their careers training as actors with two of the most respected and legendary teachers of the 20th century - Stella Adler and William Esper. Their years of working as award-winning Casting Directors has given them a unique perspective on the actors’ training and journey. In 2009, Deb and Donna joined together to realize their dream of opening a formal studio that provides the kind of training they enjoyed through the respective studios in which they studied back in New York. In a safe, nurturing environment, they utilize the techniques they studied for so many years, adapting them specifically for use in film and television.

 

Aquila Morong Studio for Actors provides more than just classes. We have an additional mission of providing opportunities for our students to perform important works for the Los Angeles Community to further their craft and stage experience. Opportunities to audition for The New Deal Theater are open to all students at Aquila Morong Studio for Actors.

 

 

What We're Doing

 

We are producing our next show, the acclaimed “CRIMES OF THE HEART” by Beth Henley, in collaboration with the Open Fist Theater Company. “CRIMES OF THE HEART” will open in early November.

 

This will be the second production for The New Deal Theatre. Our first endeavor was “PROOF,” which won FOUR Stage Scene LA Awards including Best Production Drama, as well as the Critics Choice Award from Backstage West.  The run was so successful that we extended three weeks. Our wonderful students who starred in the play were recognized for their extraordinary work in every review, and in the response from the Hollywood professional community who came to support their efforts. Our own teacher, writer/director John Hindman, was recognized with the Stage Scene LA Award for Best Direction

 

 

We Need Your Help!

 

As a brand-new company, The New Deal Theatre needs your help to bring this, and future productions to life. Our goal is to raise a minimum of $7,000.00 to produce this show in the most professional capacity possible. This money will cover the cost of props, costumes, lighting design, program design and printing, and marketing and promotion. Our director, and all of our actors, are graciously working for free and our production is staffed by student volunteers. Should we raise more than $7,000.00, additional monies will be applied toward future productions.

Our Team & Cast

Director.......John Hindman
Producer.....Deborah Aquila
Producer.....Donna Morong

Lenny..........Amy Stewart
Babe...........Rae Foster
Meg............Gray Stevenson
Chick..........Deborah Knox
Barnette.....John Bobek
Doc............Benjamin Burdick

* The play program went to press on Oct. 20. Any donors who contribute at that perk level after Oct. 20 will be thanked in a future The New Deal Theater production program.

story:
Our Story
From saving the meat of a deer hit in the road to forcing piano lessons onto small children, our Asian mothers are weird, funny, and nurturing in their own inexplicable ways. “My Asian Mom” is a theatrical show of eight, ten minute, one act plays with the common thread of Asian motherhood in all its awkward glory. Expect complex comedy, poignant drama and total honesty. We share our version of the universal mother-child relationship with respect, humour, and fond memories of the best tasting, strongest smelling food, ever. We present "My Asian Mom" in celebration of Asian Pacific American Heritage month and, of course, Mother’s Day.

"My Asian Mom" runs on Fridays and Saturdays from May 4-May 26, 2012 at 8PM at Stage 773 in Chicago, IL. This is the first show of its kind in Chicago and we're working hard to make it excellent. To put on this show, we will raise $3,500 in 30 days or none at all!

Our Impact 
The New York Times recently reported that Asian American actors were cast in only 2% of all roles in Broadway and Off Broadway productions over the past five years. This includes Asian and "color blind casted" roles. Only 2% of all roles in five years! We must create our own opportunities to tell our stories or they won't be heard. Our tales are a vital part of the American cultural experience. If we don't produce our own shows, who will?

A-Squared Theatre Workshop is a Chicago based collective that creates an artistic environment of risk taking and growth for Asian American theater artists by dynamically bringing Asian American stories to the stage for general theater-going audiences. A-Squared is a 501c3, non-profit organization.

We are dedicated to: 

- Sharing Asian American stories and experiences to the Chicago community through live theatre.

- Expanding perceptions and contexts about Asian Americans of all generations and their part in the history of America.

- Creating a safe, artistic environment for Asian American theater artists to explore, express and grow in traditional and non-traditional roles both on and off the stage in Chicago.

What We Need & What You Get
We want to put on a great, important show and need your help. We want the financial security from this fund raiser to focus on our performance knowing that the rent is paid. Here are the numbers:

$2,750 - rent & stage management costs
$300 - marketing materials
$300 - wardrobe and props
------
$3,350 - needed 
$140- the 4% that indiegogo will keep 
------
$3,490  - total needed (the extra $10 will be left at our ancestor's shrine)

Any profits made from this production will go towards funding future Asian American theater productions by our non-profit organization and towards throwing a thank you/closing party for the almost thirty cast and crew of "My Asian Mom". With your donation of $500 or more, you are invited as a special guest to this gala closing party. We also hope to afford paying our hard working talent.

All donations to A-Squared Theatre Workshop are tax deductible. Also, check out the fun perks! Again, we will raise $3,500 in 30 days or none at all.

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us tell our stories. Share this website link with your friends and families to support the arts, the artists, and their moms. Tell your friends about this fundraiser on Facebook, Twitter, and all the social media outlets you can. Collect funds and donate it for those not on Paypal. All donations are tax deductible. Thank you very much. You make our moms proud.

www.facebook.com/asquaredtw

Expect complex comedy, poignant drama and total honesty. We share our version of the universal mother-child relationship with respect, humour, and fond memories of the best tasting, strongest smelling food, ever. story:
Project Overview

'Dreamplace & The Black Box Memoir' is a new one act play - a mix of poetry and monologue written and performed by Barbara Lorraine Laing. The play was developed as part of the In(ter)ventions: Literary Practice at the Edge program at The Banff Centre in February 2012. It follows the story of Theresa, a 31 year old woman who finds herself at the bottom of the ocean floor. We listen into her underwater conversations with an old friend as she explores her own 'black box' - the parts of herself she thought were indestructible - and discover that memory, like sound, is often distorted in our 'dreamplaces'.

Currently, I am slotted to perform at The Toronto Fringe Festival's Artist Alley in July 2012. This includes 8 performance slots in a 'tent' space. The play has also been submitted to the SummerWorks Theatre Festival - and the final decision will be made on April 1st. In addition, I am in the process of securing a third summer venue in the GTA. Having returned to Canada in November after four years teaching in an English seaside town in the UK, I am currently looking to secure sponsorship, grants and other funding to assist me in establishing my company and producing new theatrical/poetic work in the Toronto area and beyond. Specifically, the new piece I created received a very positive response from faculty and peers at the In(ter)ventions program last month, and I have secured a place for it at The Toronto Fringe Festival as part of the AlleyPlays, July 4-15th.

I will be presenting the play at 2 other venues this summer, including a potential slot at the SummerWorks festival http://www.summerworks.ca/2011/home.php. If accepted into the SummerWorks festival, I will need to pay $791 in the first week of April. Below you will find a list of the primary expenses that need to be covered. By earning a minimum $1000, I will be able to cover the cost of the SummerWorks festival fee (if the play is accepted), and/or use the funds towards meeting the following needs at the Fringe and other venues:

- Publicity/Advertising

- Workshop and rehearsal space 

- Venue/Festival Entrance Fees

- Set construction & Props

- Honorarium for hiring a director and technical crew

- Transportation

- Hiring a musician

Please note that because I have been living out of province for the last four years, I do not qualify for Ontario Arts Council funding at this time.

 

Company Info

‘She’s Making a Spectacle of Herself!’ is a new theatre company which specializes in poetry, performance, interdisciplinary projects and creative workshops. We develop and support new writing and artistic work that is experimental, poetic, and engaging. Striving to create beautiful and thought provoking performances, our events and workshops aim to be playful, adaptable, all-around-sassy occasions which highlight the work of local writers, musicians and artists who support and honour creative adventures. We hope to encourage and foster a spirit of connection and collaboration between artists, educators and the community.

Why a Spectacle?

The 'actress' and women who 'perform' have always been daring. Throughout the history of theatre and literature, there has been a tendency to label women who have the power to make people laugh as 'bizarre', 'unfeminine' or as 'making spectacles of themselves'. During her graduate studies Barbara became fascinated by stories of these women who risked being 'too much' and began to see parallels in the accounts of travel writers, poets and other artists. In the context of the company’s current mandate and goals, the slightly tongue-in-cheek ‘spectacle’ reference in the title can, nowadays, be applied to anyone who dares to create something, to challenge expectations, and the sense empowerment and adventure generated by artistic exploration.

story:
Our aim since 2007 has been to create an easy to use website archiving UK Theatre. We have amased a huge number of production listings since we launched.

However, we have been beset with problems:
With the number of people using our heavily patched together site, our server is often down, and we lose visitors and page rank, so our site becomes less important.
The inability of the current site to allow user generated data to be added securely creates an unhealthy burden on the two people behind the site (who also have jobs, and a family to support)

Therefore, we are asking you to help us build the LTDb.co.uk by helping us invest in better servers which can host the nearly completed code for the new site. The design will be sleeker, faster and hold a lot more information, and much more importantly, it will allow community added information, so information on community run theatre organisations can appear alongside that of the latest West End production. We want to achieve all of this without incorporating massive ads, or a subscription based model, and with your help we’ll be able to.

Thanks for reading, please visit the site http://www.LTDb.co.uk but remember it will be better in the near future!

story:
Embodiment Project is a bay area-based street dance theater company dedicated to presenting arts as moral action to audiences of diverse demographics.   Our new work Chalk Outlines, interweaves dance, poetry, live song, and documentary theater in response to the Black Lives Matter Movement.  The piece is dedicated in loving memory to Michael Brown, Trayvon Martin, Oscar Grant, Freddie Gray, Eric Garner and the countless other African American men who have unjustly lost their lives due to police brutality.  This production includes all original music by Valerie Troutt and is performed live by her vocal ensemble MoonCandy.

As artists we feel called to respond to the reality of these times and the racial profiling that men of color have faced for centuries in America.  Realizing the intrinsic healing power of live song and movement, we strive to create performance that incites cross-cultural conversations and gives our community hope.  

This funding will go towards the Bay Area premier of Chalk Outlines on June 25th at 8pm at Destiny Arts Center.  Your contributions will allow us to cover the cost of artist fee's for the sixteen Embodiment Project company members and artistic collaborators so that we can present this show for free to our community.   This production will feature a performance by the Destiny Arts Youth Company and will set off the first night of Rennie Harris’ 18th Annual Illadleph Legends of Hip Hop Festival Bay Area, which will include workshops, panel discussions and performances with pioneers of hip hop dance from around the country.

Given the piece’s important social contribution to the community at large, we feel it is imperative to transcend socio-economic limitations and make Chalk Outlines accessible to all viewers.  We also are proud to bring this art to Destiny Arts Center, an Oakland non-profit that exists to end isolation, prejudice and violence in the lives of young people.  We need $8,000 in order to compensate the sixteen artists who are committing a tremendous amount of time and hard work to this artistic endeavor. 

For people who want to contribute to this project but cannot afford to donate at this time, you can help us to get the word out and direct traffic to our campaign.  Please feel free to you use the Indiegogo share tools.

Embodiment Project is a Member of the Intersection Incubator, a program of Intersection for the Arts providing fiscal sponsorship, incubation and consulting services to artists. Visit www.theintersection.org

For more information about Embodiment Project visit: www.embodimentproject.org

Thank you for considering supporting this project!

story:
Our Story

Realize Dance is a Non-Profit Performing Dance Company founded by two sisters who share a passion for dance.  We want to keep the arts alive in our community and, as mothers, show our children that you can follow your dreams.  Realize Dance is dedicated to creating shows that have an impact on the audience.  We are also excited to open a dance studio that is nonprofit, where we can offer classes for those who can't afford it.

The Impact

Our mission is to spread awareness of global, cultural, spiritual and emotional issues through quality dance performance.  We are ready to impact our community, our state, our country and our world through dance.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your financial support to open Realize Dance - The Studio ,which will be our rehearsal space.  We can't wait to offer classes to the community.  In return you may deduct your donation from your taxes.  Depending on the amount you may also recieve a free class or tickets to our first show.  All amounts are appreciated. Everyone who donates will be recognized on the Making it happen page of our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to your contacts or to anyone you think this may interest or inspire.

story:
THE MOTIVATION
I am interested in doing to the body, what a cinematographer does to film. I am fascinated with the ability to control where, how, when, and for how long one sees a certain image in order to build tension and guide emotional reaction. And so... 
THE WORK
I have made Underneath Where We Are- Presented by The Chocolate Factory Theater's Visiting Artist Program with support from the Dance and Theater Programs of the New York State Council on the Arts and the NYC Department of Cultural Affairs,and created, in part, with a space grant from BAX/Brooklyn Arts Exchange.
Performance Dates and Details HERE
FUNDRAISING GOAL $3000 
Expenses for this creative process(two-years worth of rehearsal rentals and dancer rehearsal pay) have come out of my own small pinhole pocket and now with the production around the corner, there are many collaborators to pay. Those collaborators have a priceless, exceptional talent that deserves reward. 
They perform my work
They light my work
They enhance my work
They give my work sound.
They make my vision a reality, so we can share it with you.

MAKE YOUR YEAR-END DONATION TAX WRITE-OFFS NOW!
$10 gift= 2 hours of rehearsal pay for one performer (over 100 hours of rehearsal!)
$50 gift= 5 hours of rehearsal rental space (40 rented hours of space!)
$100 gift=  one evening of performance pay for one performer (2 performers-4 nights!)
$300 gift=  contribution towards documentation of work (you get what you pay for!)
$500 gift=  contribution towards designer/collaborator fees ( a HUGE help!)

Thank you, and happy holidays!

story:
Don't Miss ICARUS – an Americana Myth!!!

See Minnie Minoseczeck's Menagerie of Marvels, a show of amazements and abominations, traversing the landscape of the Great Depression! See Passionate Penny fly through the air! Hear the mellifluous music of Icarus! Will they escape the monsters and machinations to freedom?

 

Be warned: MINNIE MINOSECZECK'S MENAGERIE OF MARVELS IS NOT RESPONSIBLE IF YOU GOT A WEAK HEART.

 

Premiering May 17 & 18 at the Cambridge YMCA Theatre in Central Square.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET ICARUS OFF THE GROUND!

 

What is ICARUS?

Liars & Believers is proud to share our next experimental songplay, ICARUS. We’ve taken the ancient myth of Daedalus and Icarus and blown it wide open to look at how America is getting through the Great Recession. Developed collaboratively with actors, writers, musicians, artists and puppeteers over the past ten months, ICARUS is a tale of poverty, love, oppression and transcendence.

 

Expect to be surprised and delighted! ICARUS features an original Americana score by Nathan Leigh (Song of Songs), movement, burlesque, and the fantastical puppetry by Faye Dupras!

 

Featuring: Austin Auh, Veronica Barron, Steven Emanuelson, Corianna Moffat and Aimee Rose Ranger 

With design by: Aaron Sherkow, Kendra Bell, Marc Ewart and George Courage 

 

Where can I see ICARUS?

Join us for the world premiere of ICARUS at the Cambridge YMCA Theatre on May 17 & 18 Only!

 

Just 2 chances to see this show in all its glory in Boston.

 

Then we’re taking ICARUS to New York for the New York Musical Theatre Festival in July!

 

Will you help get help get ICARUS up to New York?

 

Who is the LAB?

Liars & Believers is an experimental theater company dedicated to expanding the language of live performance. Through collaborations with exciting local artists of all kinds, we strive to make Boston a center for theatrical innovation. We were just featured in American Theatre Magazine and we’ve been called the “region’s most experimental and visionary artists.”

 

In the past 4 years we’ve worked with: Neil Gaiman, Mali Sastri (Jaggery), Walter Sickert & The Army of Broken Toys, Steven Bogart, Johnny Blazes, Eric Bornstein, Madge of Honor, Emperor Norton’s Stationary Marching Band, The Boston Typewriter Orchestra, Mighty Tiny, The Michael J. Epstein Memorial Library, The Doctors Fox, Kristilyn Stevenson, Raul Gonzalez III, Tyler Brown, Masha Obolensky, The Furies, UnAmerika's Sweetheart Karin Webb, and dozens of other local actors, musicians, choreographers and designers.

 

We need your help to keep creating - to keep innovating – to Produce ICARUS!

 

Join the Crowd!

By supporting ICARUS, you’re part of the community of people who are participating and enjoying a revolution in Boston Arts! Join the enthusiastic audience that makes possible exciting art like this. With your donation, you’re encouraging local artists to take risks and create in new ways to delight and surprise you.

 

  

Where does the money go?

All funds we raise go directly toward the art. Take a look:

 

  • Performer salaries ($10,500)
  • Designers and other Artists ($12,500)
  • Costumes ($1,400)
  • Props ($800)
  • Puppets ($1,000)
  • Sound equipment ($1,000)
  • Lighting equipment ($1,000)
  • Set material ($1,000)
  • Rehearsal and Performance Rental ($1,500)

· as well as Indiegogo’s fees (3% if we make our goal and 7% if we don’t) and credit card processing fees (3%)

As you can see, the cost of the show is more than the $2,000 we set as our goal. That’s our minimal goal. Really, we need to raise $3,000.

And the rest?

We’ve received a grant from the Cambridge Arts Council and Mass Cultural Council, and we’ve raised the rest from generous donors who have gotten us most of the way. Now we need YOU to get over the finish line.

 

Liars & Believers is a 501(c)(3) non-profit, so all of your donation, above your ticket ($20/$30) and Soundtrack download ($25) is tax deductible!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

· Sign up for our mailing list! Be the first to find out details, get an exclusive discount code and updates from behind the scenes. You can sign up atwww.liarsandbelievers.com/mailinglist

· Spread the word! Tell everyone you know. Post this to Facebook, twitter, even Google+!

· Volunteer! We’re going to need some extra hands to pull this off. E-mail Rachel[at]liarsandbelievers.com for more information.

Just 2 chances to see this show in all its glory in Boston.
 
Then we’re taking ICARUS to New York for the New York Musical Theatre Festival in July!
 
Will you help get help get ICARUS up to New York?
 
Who is the LAB?
Liars & Believers is an experimental theater company dedicated to expanding the language of live performance. Through collaborations with exciting local artists of all kinds, we strive to make Boston a center for theatrical innovation. We were just featured in American Theatre Magazine and we’ve been called the “region’s most experimental and visionary artists.”
 
In the past 4 years we’ve worked with: Neil Gaiman, Mali Sastri (Jaggery), Walter Sickert & The Army of Broken Toys, Steven Bogart, Johnny Blazes, Eric Bornstein, Madge of Honor, Emperor Norton’s Stationary Marching Band, The Boston Typewriter Orchestra, Mighty Tiny, The Michael J. Epstein Memorial Library, The Doctors Fox, Kristilyn Stevenson, Raul Gonzalez III, Tyler Brown, Masha Obolensky, The Furies, UnAmerika's Sweetheart Karin Webb, and dozens of other local actors, musicians, choreographers and designers.
 

We need your help to keep creating - to keep innovating – to Produce ICARUS!

 
Join the Crowd!
By supporting ICARUS, you’re part of the community of people who are participating and enjoying a revolution in Boston Arts! Join the enthusiastic audience that makes possible exciting art like this. With your donation, you’re encouraging local artists to take risks and create in new ways to delight and surprise you.
 
  
Where does the money go?
All funds we raise go directly toward the art. Take a look:
 

Performer salaries ($10,500)
Designers and other Artists ($12,500)
Costumes ($1,400)
Props ($800)
Puppets ($1,000)
Sound equipment ($1,000)
Lighting equipment ($1,000)
Set material ($1,000)
Rehearsal and Performance Rental ($1,500)
· as well as Indiegogo’s fees (3% if we make our goal and 7% if we don’t) and credit card processing fees (3%)
As you can see, the cost of the show is more than the $2,000 we set as our goal. That’s our minimal goal. Really, we need to raise $3,000.
And the rest?
We’ve received a grant from the Cambridge Arts Council and Mass Cultural Council, and we’ve raised the rest from generous donors who have gotten us most of the way. Now we need YOU to get over the finish line.
 
Liars & Believers is a 501(c)(3) non-profit, so all of your donation, above your ticket ($20/$30) and Soundtrack download ($25) is tax deductible!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
· Sign up for our mailing list! Be the first to find out details, get an exclusive discount code and updates from behind the scenes. You can sign up atwww.liarsandbelievers.com/mailinglist
· Spread the word! Tell everyone you know. Post this to Facebook, twitter, even Google+!
· Volunteer! We’re going to need some extra hands to pull this off. E-mail Rachel[at]liarsandbelievers.com for more information.

story:
Who We Are

Williams Theatre Group is comprised of two great organizations sharing one amazing stage. For almost 30 years, Drama Learning Center has been providing the highest in quality theatre education to students in central Maryland. Red Branch Theatre Company is a professional, non-Equity theatre in residence at Drama Learning Center. Now entering its sixth season, Red Branch continues to be dedicated to fostering a life-long love of theatre in its audiences through professional performances and a passionate acting company.

Between the two organizations, we produce close to 30 unique theatrical productions a year – that’s a lot of backsides in our seats, and they are showing the wear and tear that comes with a well-loved theatre. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have been presented with the opportunity to obtain professional theatrical seating secondhand from a local university performing arts center. We have the seats, we have the installer, now we just need the funds to transport and install the new seats to our space! Any contribution you can make to our cause wil

story:
Päivitys/Update
Hieno lehtijuttu Iiriksestä! Nice article about Iiris in a magazine!
"Jump to New York"

Lue juttu täältä/see the article here: https://www.forum24.fi/sivut/artikkeli/18958/Nu...

(in English below every chapter)

Iiris on 14-vuotias innokas ballettitanssija Oulusta. Hän osallistui Pariisissa järjestetyn balettikilpailun semifinaaliin viime syksynä. Menestys oli niin hyvä, että hänet kutsuttiin ainoana suomalaisena maailman suurimman balettikilpailun finaaliin, joka pidetään New Yorkissa huhtikuussa 2017 (Youth America Grand Prix, http://yagp.org/ ). Lisäksi Iiris palkittiin kahden arvostetun saksalaisen ja ranskalaisen balettikoulun kurssistipendeillä. Iiris on kirjoittanut Pariisin kokemuksistaan mielenkiintoisen ja hauskan blogitekstin, lue se täältä:  http://balettiajataitorullaluistelua.blogspot.fi/ .

Iiris is an aspiring young ballerina from Oulu, Finland. She is 14 years old and dancing is her passion. Last year, Iiris participated in the semi-finals of Youth America Grand Prix (YAGP) in Paris. She was the only one from Finland honored with an invitation to compete in the world's largest student ballet competition finals in New York. The finals will be held in April, 2017, see http://yagp.org/ for more information. In addition, she was awarded with ballet courses in Germany and France, which will be held later this year. See her exciting moments in Paris from http://balettiajataitorullaluistelua.blogspot.fi/ (in Finnish).

Iiris opiskelee tällä hetkellä balettia Oulu Dance Academy ssä (ODA). Hän aloitti opinnot Balettikoulu Sinikellossa ja jatkoi sen jälkeen Oulun ammattikorkeakoulun baletin erikoiskoulutusluokan oppilaana. Iiris is now studying ballet at Oulu Dance Academy. She started her studies at Balettikoulu Sinikello and then continued at Oulu University of Applied Sciences.

Alaikäisenä Iiris tarvitsee matkalle mukaansa huoltajan. Isosisko Lilja toimii Iiriksen huoltajana ja tukena kilpailumatkan ajan. Teimme tämän kampanjan heidän matkakustannustensa kattamiseksi. Otamme kiitollisuudella vastaan kaiken apunne ja tarjoamme vastineeksi alla lueteltuja vaihtoehtoja. Postikulut Euroopan sisällä kuuluvat hintaan!

  • Iiriksen ja Liljan matkapäivitykset somessa, sekä henkilökohtainen kiitoksenosoitus somepäivityksissä. Jaamme päivityksiä matkaa varten luodulla Facebook-sivullamme.
  • Upea Iiriksen tai Liljan tekemä balettiavaimenperä ja/tai nimikoitu tossupussi, katso kuvat alta!
  • 20% alennuskoodi balettikauppa Tutu Studio Borealikseen, katso kuva ja linkki sivun lopussa!
  • "Double Duet Dancers"–tiimin järjestämä viikonlopun mittainen balettikurssi kesällä Oulussa. Suunnattu 10-13-vuotiaille vähintään vuoden balettia harrastaneille. Mukana opettamassa Iiriksen oopperalla balettia opiskelevat isosiskot. Lisätietoja ja ilmoittautuminen: doubleduetdancers@gmail.com.
  • Iiriksen ja isosiskojen järjestämä yksityinen balettiesitys esimerkiksi lasten syntymäpäiville tai häihin! Sovi ajankohdasta ja kysy lisätietoa: doubleduetdancers@gmail.com
  • Mainonta: painamme haluamasi nimen/logon Iiriksen ja hänen tiiminsä kilpailuasusteisiin ja laukkuihin. Lisätietoa ja logon/nimen lähettäminen: doubleduetdancers@gmail.com

In order to get the New York trip financed, we set up this campaign, and are now asking for your support. The expenses we are looking assistance with are the flights and hotels associated with the trip, both for Iris and her big sister Lilja, who will be her guardian and manager during the trip. We came up with some nice items in order to make it easy for you to support Iiris in her goal. They are listed below with descriptions. Shipping is free inside Europe, to the rest of the world actual shipping costs are added.

  • Personal thank-you in social media, and online updates during the trip. We set up Facebook page to share our experiences in New York.
  • Nice and useful ballet key ring and/or ballet slipper bag with a name of your choice, carefully handmade by Iiris and Lilja, see pictures below!
  • 20% discount code to ballet shop Tutu Studio Borealis, see picture and link in the bottom of the page.
  • Advertising: a name/logo of your choice printed into the costumes and bags of Iiris and her team. More information and sending the logo/name: doubleduetdancers@gmail.com

Jos kampanjamme keräyssumma ylittää tavoitteen, tai jos onnistumme saamaan muualta apurahaa, ylimenevä osuus käytetään Iiriksen Ranskan balettikurssin kustannusten kattamiseen. Koska Iiris tarvitsee New Yorkin kilpailumatkalle mukaan balettiopettajansa Arjan, haluaisimme osallistua myös hänen matkakuluihinsa. Yritämme tietysti kattaa matkakuluista omin voimin niin paljon kuin mahdollista. Kampanjasumman arvioitu jakautuminen:

  • Lentoliput 600 € per henkilö, yhteensä 1200 €
  • Majoitus 10 yöltä, kaksi henkeä, yhteensä 1500 €
  • Vastikkeiden materiaalit ja muut kampanjakulut, 300 €

When exceeding our financial goal, or if we get a stipend from somewhere, the funding will be used to cover a ballet course expenses for Iiris in France during the spring. Also, Iiris’ ballet teacher will travel with her to the New York competition.  She will help Iiris train herself for the competition to improve her chances of success.  As we very much like to see her attend the competition we will cover all day to day expenses that we can afford ourselves.The estimated distribution of campaign sum is as follows:

  • Flight tickets 600 € per person, 1200 € in total
  • Accommodation for 10 nights for two persons, 1500 € in total
  • Reward materials and other campaign costs, 300 €

Päivitys: Valitse haluamasi avaimenperä alla olevasta kuvasta! Lähetä numero viestissä.
Update: Select a ballet key ring you want from the picture below! Send the number with a message.

Tunnus- ja Facebook-jakokuva: Petri Kekkonen
Card and Facebook Share Photo: Petri Kekkonen

Balettiavaimenperä, Iiriksen ja Liljan itse tekemä.
Ballet Key Ring, handmade by Iiris and Lilja.

Nimikoitu tossupussi, Iiriksen ja Liljan käsin tekemä.
Ballet Slipper Bag with Name (of your choice), handmade by Iiris and Lilja.

Tutu Studio Borealis on startup-yritys, jonka ovat perustaneet Double Duet Dancers-tiimi eli Lilja, Iiris ja heidän siskonsa Elise ja Heljä.
Tutu Studio Borealis is a start-up company established by Double Duet Dancers (Lilja, Iiris and their sisters Elise and Heljä).
https://www.etsy.com/shop/tutustudioborealis

story:
BREAKING NEWS!  GREEN EYES HAS A MATCHING DONOR! 

FOR THE FINAL 5 DAYS OF OUR CAMPAIGN, ALL CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE MATCHED, UP TO $3000. THAT'S RIGHT. FOR EVERY $1 YOU GIVE, YOU EFFECTIVELY GIVE $2! 


“Sensitively directed by Travis Chamberlain and shrewdly acted by Erin Markey, Tennessee Williams' GREEN EYES is gorgeous: a short, eloquent evening that feels complete, complex, and entirely satisfying. I'd like to think [this production] sounds a clarion call for more first-rate productions of Williams' much demeaned later work.”

                –John Lahr, The New Yorker


OUR STORY

Straight from its sold-out premiere run in New York City, Travis Chamberlain’s highly acclaimed site-specific production of Tennessee Williams' GREEN EYES debuts in downtown Boston at The Ames Hotel, presented by Company One ---- January 18-Febraury 15, 2012.

This no-holds-barred production stuns with a searing lead performance by Erin Markey—“a kittenish vixen whose sexual pliancy hides an iron will” (The New York Times)—duking it out with her husband on their honeymoon in New Orleans.  In the course of an evening, GREEN EYES transforms an actual hotel suite into a psychosexual battleground, where desire and violence become indistinguishable. Produced by Chris Keegan and The Kindness.



THE IMPACT

Presented by Company One, "one of the 10 most inspiring and innovative theatre companies on our national landscape”  according to The American Theater Wing (Tony Awards), the Boston premiere of GREEN EYES is going to prove, yet again, why this production remains one of the most talked-about debuts of Williams’ work in recent years.

Penned in 1970 and then hidden away for decades, GREEN EYES was only just published in 2008, twenty-five years after Williams’ death. Your support allows to us bring this “lost” romantic thriller to a broader public, illuminating the provocative relevance of Williams’ rarely produced late experimental plays for contemporary audiences.

ALSO: This year marks Williams’ centennial. And with your help, we'd like to give him the best birthday present a playwright (dead or alive) could wish for--A PREMIERE!!



WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We've got the gig. We've got our team. We've got a great show. These things are certain.

But we still need your help. Our goal for this campaign is $3000.

Your donations will get us there (via Amtrak) and put a roof over our heads (for a month) during the month that we will be working in Boston. Donations will also contribute to rehearsal expenses, administrative overhead, and, perhaps most importantly, our day-to-day quality of life as artists who too often overextend, cut corners, and grossly underpay ourselves (when we're lucky) in order to take advantage of opportunities (like this) to share our work with new audiences.

$3000 only covers a fraction of the money we need to raise for this production (based on what we feel comfortable asking for through IndieGoGo), so if we make our goal, please do not let that deter you from continuing to give. We promise to put your money to good use!

TAX DEDUCTIBLE

All donations are eligible for tax deduction, but it is not automatically applied through IndieGoGo. Thus, if you would like to make a contribution and receive a tax deduction, please contact us at thekindnessnyc@gmail.com. It's super easy, quick, and painless. We will happily assist you if you have any questions. Don't be shy. The rewards listed here will, of course, still apply.

story:
A New Home for Actors, Artists, and Audience

In Syracuse there are a host of small community theater companies, but no dedicated space devoted to community theater and performance programming.  Many of the civic and private theaters in Syracuse have priced themselves out of affordability for most small or even large community theaters.  Enter our project, The Central New York Playhouse:

 

A Unique Space with a Unique Mission

We are building a new home for Actors, Artists, and Audience.  The space we have chosen is a former retail space in Shoppingtown Mall.  Our 4500 complex will have 800 square feet of performance space, a full rehearsal room, a music room, a secondary cabaret area, and of course our audience area able to seat almost 200 people.

 

The Construction Fund Goals

But before we open we need your help.  Proper construction of our stage is expensive.  The stage needs to be made of fire treated wood & the curtains have to be fire retardant.  That is to say nothing about tables, chairs, re-designing the entryway into the theater and curtaining a long line of windows on one side of the theater.  That is why we are hoping that you will help kick start our project and help us fund it fully and beyond.

 
 

Opportunities for Hundreds of Local Actors and Artists, and Potentially Several Thousand Audience Members

Once we build our stage we have a very intense main stage schedule.  Over the next 13 months we will bring 10 fully staged theatrical productions.  Our productions range from farcical comedies, to poignant classics, and 3 full scale musicals.  Four of our offerings will be Central New York premieres including the CNY amateur premiere of Monty Python's Spamalot taking the stage in the first weekend it will be available to community theaters in North America.

 

A Home for the Entire Community.

But the Central New York Playhouse is more than just one company.  We will be opening up our doors to other theater companies and community organizations so they can produce and explore their art on our stage. Already we have scheduled with several community groups that will use our space,  the first being Don't Feed the Actors Improv troupe who will perform 10 comedy shows here over the next 13 months, former Syracuse Post Standard Humor columnist and SALT award winning writer Jeff Kramer will bring a new sketch comedy show "Skit Happens" to our stage in 2013, the Thumbs-Up Improv festival will happen in April 2013 involving close to a dozen improv groups throughout central New York, and a Murder Mystery and Cabaret series will also fill out some nights.

 

So, if you help us build this stage, you are actually helping us build a home... a home for those who want to give back to the community... a new home for actors, artists, and audience. Please help us jump start this dream into a reality.

We are building a new home for Actors, Artists, and Audience.  The space we have chosen is a former retail space in Shoppingtown Mall.  Our 4500 complex will have 800 square feet of performance space, a full rehearsal room, a music room, a secondary cabaret area, and of course our audience area able to seat almost 200 people.

 
The Construction Fund Goals
But before we open we need your help.  Proper construction of our stage is expensive.  The stage needs to be made of fire treated wood & the curtains have to be fire retardant.  That is to say nothing about tables, chairs, re-designing the entryway into the theater and curtaining a long line of windows on one side of the theater.  That is why we are hoping that you will help kick start our project and help us fund it fully and beyond.
 

 
Opportunities for Hundreds of Local Actors and Artists, and Potentially Several Thousand Audience Members
Once we build our stage we have a very intense main stage schedule.  Over the next 13 months we will bring 10 fully staged theatrical productions.  Our productions range from farcical comedies, to poignant classics, and 3 full scale musicals.  Four of our offerings will be Central New York premieres including the CNY amateur premiere of Monty Python's Spamalot taking the stage in the first weekend it will be available to community theaters in North America.

 
A Home for the Entire Community.
But the Central New York Playhouse is more than just one company.  We will be opening up our doors to other theater companies and community organizations so they can produce and explore their art on our stage. Already we have scheduled with several community groups that will use our space,  the first being Don't Feed the Actors Improv troupe who will perform 10 comedy shows here over the next 13 months, former Syracuse Post Standard Humor columnist and SALT award winning writer Jeff Kramer will bring a new sketch comedy show "Skit Happens" to our stage in 2013, the Thumbs-Up Improv festival will happen in April 2013 involving close to a dozen improv groups throughout central New York, and a Murder Mystery and Cabaret series will also fill out some nights.

 
So, if you help us build this stage, you are actually helping us build a home... a home for those who want to give back to the community... a new home for actors, artists, and audience. Please help us jump start this dream into a reality.

story:
About Us!

Propaganda! The Musical is a new musical from dynamic duo Matthew Webster (writer of Kingdom Come, winner of Best Show at the Downtown Urban Theater Festival 2012) and Taylor Ferrera (YouTube darling of "Legitimate Rape" fame.) 

Propaganda! The Musical portrays the journey of young, innocent "Rookie" as he takes over his grandfather's business - a business full of secrets!!  Join Rookie as he discovers that ignorance may not always be bliss...

A lot of work has to be done before premiering in New York City in 2013!  A key step is workshopping the show in a place widely considered "Little London" : Orlando, FL (*it is possible that no one calls Orlando "Little London."*) in one of the premiere theaters in Florida.  Through this we will be able to fill out the musical sound of the ensemble, work through kinks of the script, discover what works in front of a live audience, and leave with a working script ready to be fully produced in New York!

Where Is My Money Going? 

  • Rehearsal/Performance Space
    • Cost: $400
    • Check it out here: http://orlandoshakes.org/pdfs/maps/Mandell.pdf
  • Piano Rental
    • Cost: $150 per day
  • Printing/Paper
    • Cost: $10 per script
    • Cost: $10 per score
      • Total cost for a 15 person cast and 5 person band with full libretto and score: $350
    • Cost: $.25 per program (for the staged reading)
      • Total cost for 100 programs: $25
  • Travel
    • Flights
      • $500 for two roundtrip tickets
    • Car (provided)
      • $120 for gas for three weeks
  • Lodging
    • Provided for the creative team traveling from NYC by a private donor. 

 

  • The TOTAL COST outlined in this budget plan: $1,645.00

 

This is more than we are asking for.  Because this is a new project and experience for us, we are more than willing to cover the remaining costs.  What we’re asking for is help.  Your generous contributions towards our goal of $1000.00 will help to cut over half the cost of our workshop.  If we raise more than this goal, it will help us alleviate these early out-of-pocket expenses.   No contribution is too small…and no contribution is too big!    

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Please spread the word!  Keep an eye out for chances in the future to share in all the Propaganda!  And THANK YOU!!!

http://www.facebook.com/PropagandaTheMusical

story:
HELLO ALL!!
I am thrilled and excited to inform you that our third Freight Project is well on its way!!!!
The Freight Project is a week long multi-disciplined artist retreat focused on developing brand new works.

 Last year we housed, transported and fed 18 artists in Cambridge, New York for 8 days on just 1600 dollars. Expanding from just the plays we have had in the past we included an aerial dance theater piece by Adam Wolley and a play by Jordan Simmons as part of the Hubbard Hall Summer season. The retreat atmosphere allows a focused environment for the playwrights to work in conjunction with the actors and directors to create in a unique way. With some of the pieces being written during the week it was amazing what we were able to accomplish!

This year we are expanding even mre. We are producing 4 works in different disciplines: Jonathan Royce WIndam will be working on a Danch Theater piece, Rachel Lambert will be working on her screenplay, Michal Shane will be developing his play, Deving Preston and Stacy Salvette will be developing a one woman show, and Sharone Halevy and Paul Eddy will be developing  their music. We are bringing up 26 people!! We  need your help! Learning from last year we know that we need to rent cars, have more production assistance, we need a bigger budget for food, for production costs, and most importantly we need a bigger budget to have a showing in New York City.

In order to make this happen we need your support!
Help us meet our goal of 4000 dollars and you are helping us expand our dream for the Freight!

Thank you sincerely in advance for watching our video.

Yours truly,
Rachael Shane
Oscar+Lottie Productions

story:
DANNY (A New Musical)

An Off-Broadway show starting in New Orleans Louisiana?

"Danny" is a traveling, Off-Broadway show written by actor, Daylon Micah Othello. It is a story about a 24 year old law student who finds a baby on a subway platform and takes on the task of raising him.

  • Book by

Daylon Micah Othello and Ivan Hoey Jr.

  • Music and Lyrics by

Chase Lubag and Daylon Micah Othello

  • Directed by

Ivan Hoey Jr.

What will helping us do?

  • Helping us will help the community witness this wonderful Off-Broadway production.

  • Your donations will help cover necessary expenses for putting together a quality production.

  • It will also provide us the ability to travel. Traveling helps the show get known.

We are not the only ones benefiting from such a wonderful thing. So will you. We have great things to offer you as you help us out.

How will "Danny" impact your life?

"Danny" is a heartfelt story; one that you are surely not to forget.

I don't have money how can I still contribute?

You can still contribute to "Danny" without thinning out your already thin wallet.

  • Make some noise about the Off-Broadway show.

  • "Please share our Indiego using the 'share tools!'"

  • Don't forget to "share" and "like" our official facebook page.

That’s all there is to it, unless you find some other ways. Feel free to help out in anyway possible.

 We all thank you in advance.

story:
Easter

by August Strindberg

Produced by Naught, A Theatre Company

Please help us raise $2000 over the next month to put up this beautiful play.

We raised $800 at our fundraiser in March. That is only enough to pay for our rehearsal space!

We still need to fund the booking of the theatre, transportation, set, props, and costumes. Since Easter is a period play, set in turn-of-the-century Sweden, we have to buy and refinish some of the set pieces and props so that they look the part--that doesn't come too cheap. Of course, we are trying to cut costs wherever we can: by borrowing from other companies, rehearsing at the cheapest spaces in town, not advertising on video billboards on the Gardiner, etc. Most importantly, we want to put up a show that lives up to our artistic vision and standards. 

Easter is an absolutely beautiful play. Every line is a piece of poetry. That is the first thing that drew me to this play: the beauty that seeps out of it, which I found so affective upon first reading. This beauty is steeped in spirituality, and engaging with this spirituality has been a transforming experience for everybody working on the play. Lines like: "Benjamin, open the curtains - I want God to see us" are mystical and metaphysical, and the cast and I have worked hard to bring these lines to life. Strindberg's characters are at once archetypal and visceral, forcing each other towards grace, pulling out the rug of hypocrisy, so that the prideful can learn what it means to fall.

Please, help out in any way you can. Every $5 makes a tremendous difference towards how successful and effective this show can be. We appreciate your support!

Sincerely,

William Rasitsan-Powell

Artistic Director

Naught, A Theatre Company


Here's some information about the production of Easter:

Spring is coming. The ice is finally melting in the streets and in our hearts. The Heyst family has been consumed with pride and shame, but these will be torn from them, no matter how hard they cling. Naught, A Theatre Company, presents Easter, a lesser-known work by the brilliant turn-of-the-century Swedish playwright August Strindberg. Easter is the story of the changing of the seasons, of moving towards the light, of learning to embrace change. It is filled with beautiful language and characters who are caught up in spiritual agony and ecstasy: sometimes both at once. Directed by William Rasitsan-Powell, the show will open Friday April 25th, 2014 and run until Saturday May 3rd, 2014 at The Box Toronto, a new and exciting space in Toronto.

Easter features an energetic and risk-taking cast, starring Mathieu Burdan, Stephanie Seaton, Eva Barrie, Addison Becker, Jamie Johnson and Margaret Hild.

Easter is the second production by Naught, A Theatre Company, which is committed to producing spiritual and metaphysical pieces that seek to breathe new life into the theatre. The company was founded in 2013 by husband and wife duo William and Beata Rasitsan-Powell. Their first production was William's play Something Is Wrong, in the summer of 2013. Easter is a chance for the company to develop its mandate and to broaden it to include existing works that inspire the moving, spiritual experience that the company wants to bring to audiences.

Show information for Easter:

Venue: The Box Toronto, 89 Niagara St.

Opens: April 25, 2014

Closes: May 3, 2014

Performances: April 25-26; May 1-3, 8PM

Tickets: $18; Student $12

Tickets are available at http://naughttheatre.wordpress.com/buytickets/, in person, or at the door. Tickets for opening night can be reserved by emailing naughttheatre@gmail.com . For more information, visit naughttheatre.wordpress.com

story:
A PREMIERE!

'The Aeneid' will be a Canadian English-language première !!! Written by Quebecois playwright Olivier Kemeid, translated  Talisman Theatre by Judith Miller, and directed by Zach Fraser, it has never been produced in English in Montreal! Opening March 6, 2014 at La Chapelle, 'The Aeneid' will star Marcelo Arroyo, Deena Aziz and Chimwemwe Miller--three actor/puppeteers.

The Aeneid poster

THE SYNOPSIS:

Kemeid’s Aeneid is a perfect blend of epic legend and contemporary reality. It is rich with scenes of drama, but also moments of humour.  Kemeid's version of this classic tale migrates Aeneas's search for a homeland into the modern world of middle-eastern revolution. In this new twist, we encounter tourist resorts, refugee camps, and immigration officers, but the magic of the original epic remains in a visit to Hades, and encounters with spirits.

"The Aeneid' is inspired by the mythological qualities that live within Virgil’s epic poem. Its message is as relevant today as when it was written: the importance of family, friends, and a place called ‘home’. Kemeid has succeeded in unifying the ancient past and the living present, the supernatural and natural orders. This is a universal tale that speaks not only to Quebecers, but also to the peoples of the world.

OUR MISSION:

'The Aeneid' fulfills Talisman's mission by bringing the immigrant experience of ever-evolving Quebecois culture to non-Francophone audiences. We bring contemporary Quebecois works in translation to the English stage. Talisman speaks from the heart of Quebec culture preserving the Quebecois 'edge' often blurred in translation.

ABOUT US:

Talisman Theatre is an award-winning Montreal-based production company in its seventh season. It was founded in 2005 by Lyne Paquette, Talisman's Artistic Director/Set Designer and by Emma Tibaldo. Since 2005 Talisman has relied upon its core team of professional designers, developing its craft and vocabulary to make each Talisman production a culturally incisive and well-integrated performance.

Our Canadian charity registration number is: 801959826RR0001. This means that we can issue you with a charitable donation tax receipt to reduce your tax burden!

Your contribution will be converted into U.S. Dollars.

NOTE: If you do not see the "contribute" button on the right-hand side of your screen, your browser may not be supported. Please, either upgrade your browser or use an other browser like safari or firefox or visit our website to make your donation.
www.talisman-theatre.com
